Package Network.Queries

Class AttributeQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • Network.Queries.Query
      • Network.Queries.AttributeQuery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class AttributeQuery
extends Query
implements java.io.Serializable
    This is a query argumentType for accessing an QueryClient to retrieve attribute values. The following queries are supported:
    - FIRST returns the first attribute value (maybe subject to the constraints) - STREAM returns a stream of argument values (maybe subject to the constraints) - FIND returns the first non-null function application.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • AttributeQuery

        public AttributeQuery​(java.lang.String conceptId,
                      java.lang.String attributeId,
                      AttributeQuery.AttributeQueryType queryType,
                      Query.AnswerType answerType)
        constructs a query
        Parameters:
        conceptId - the applicationName of the concept for which the attribute is to be retrieved.
        attributeId - the identifier for the attribute.
        queryType - the argumentType of the expected answer (direct or stream)
        answerType - either DIRECT or STREAM

    • Method Detail

      • addConstraint

        public AttributeQuery addConstraint​(AttributeValueList constraints)
        adds a constraint to the query.
        Parameters:
        constraints - the applicationName of the constraint attribute
        Returns:
        the query itself.

      • addFilter

        public boolean addFilter​(java.lang.String argumentType,
                         java.lang.String code)
        adds a filter for filtering the answers. Filtering the answers at the server side reduces the network load.
        Parameters:
        code - the Groovy code for the filter
        argumentType - the argumentType of the values to be filtered.
        Returns:
        true if the code could be compiled and the filter adde.

      • addFinder

        public boolean addFinder​(java.lang.String argumentType,
                         java.lang.String resultType,
                         java.lang.String code)
        adds a finder. A finder traverses argument values and returns the first non-null value.
        Parameters:
        argumentType - the argumentType of the attribute values.
        code - the Groovy code for the finder. The parameter is "concept".
        resultType - the result-type of the finder code.
        Returns:
        true if the code was compiled

      • answer

        public java.lang.Object answer​(Context context)
        This method is called by the server to generate an answer to the query.
        Specified by:
        answer in class Query
        Parameters:
        context - the context for generating the answer
        Returns:
        either the answer object, or the stream of answer objects

        returns a string representation of the query.
